title: @Riot Abnormally low kill rate on Malzahar?
body:
I've noticed something strange in the API data for Malzahar, his kill rate has become abnormally low.

While I can understand people saying, "Thank god he doesn't get kills anymore", it seems peculiar that is all of his abilities being damage focused, and the lock down from his ult, he is no longer getting kills as you would expect from an anti-assassin champion. Furthermore, this also suggests that the changes have caused Malzahar players to play extremely passively, as his other stats are now also extremely mediocre compared to other mid lane champions.

Have the changes moved Malzahar into a more healthy niche, or removed interesting gameplay and interactivity?

http://champion.gg/champion/Malzahar/Middle

replies.body:
Simply put, Malzahar has no way of securing a kill for himself.

His Q is the only "Burst" he has (and it isn't for very much).
His Voidlings hurt like a bitch, but each individual hit will only deal ~50-75 damage.
His E and R seriously hurt, but only over a long period of time.

It's a similar reason as to why Singed has 18th place in damage among toplaners, but is 55th in kills.

Malzahar mid is 27th in damage and 40th in kills. 

The old Malzahar couldn't do this very well either, but his ult let him straight up melt single targets.

> The old Malzahar couldn't do this very well either

What're you talking about, old Malzahar with smartcast used to be the stuff of nightmares.

I mean that, back then, he still had very little instant damage.

He had enough DOT to 100-0 people in the duration of his ult, so he could get kills 1v1, but the individual ticks did little enough damage that in a teamfight, it was unlikely for Malzahar to be the one getting kills (besides his E picking off a straggler),

Yeah, but the difference was leveling order. Now you level voidlings first, e second, q last. Before, you maxed e first (which quickly became face-melting with 5 ranks in it) and then q, so you got your 'burst' earlier.

http://champion.gg/champion/Malzahar

Most people seem to still max E first.
Dude, max E first
E is still the most reliable farming and harass tool, especially when combined with DFT.

**Short and simple answer:** 
Malzahar's damage was gutted with the rework with not much compensation. 

**Detailed answer:** 
Lower base damage **and** ratios on Q and E, more frequent % AoE damage replaced with unreliable voidlings, and ult only does damage while the target stays in the AoE, which isn't much on its own.

The only times he actually does damage is when the enemy doesn't get {{item:3211}} {{item:3155}} {{item:3140}} .

That's the problem with the new Malzahar. Before the rework, his high damage was justified because he had **0 mobility and 0 disengage**. Clear weaknesses. New Malzahar still has those same weaknesses with even less MS now, except he has the new pseudo-Banshee's shield. Sure it grants him a bit of safety he sorely needed, but it's very easy to pop, and when it's popped, he's then nothing more than a weaker version of his former self. 

Smart players know how to play around the passive and don't unload their full combos before it dissipates. Bronzies/stupid people who failed at this cried to Riot for nerfs.

Honestly, laning with Malzahar now feels like such a chore. It's much harder to CS than before with his E being so weak. Late-game, the only reliable thing he can do is ult a high-priority target, who will more than likely have QSS anyway. 

Malzahar is now a ranged Warwick.
There, I said it.
His ad build seems to be more reliable than the ap one. Kinda sad really for a mage.

> Smart players know how to play around the passive and don't unload their full combos before it dissipates. Bronzies/stupid people who failed at this cried to Riot for nerfs.

Yeah, his near-100% pick/ban rate among the pros totally backs up your statement.  Kappa
Just like the pros in DotA2, the pros in League are basically playing a different game to everyone else.

But the point remains that the best and smartest LoL players in the world are either picking or banning Malz.  Thus, the statement that smart players will simply play around  him is patently false, unless you consider banning him playing around him.

He was a 100% pick/ban because pros don't play on our patch, they play on the last patch before the split starts if I remember correctly (or something like that) so they still had the 1 sec lasting passive and the lower cd. Right now malzahar is extremely weak, his passive is literally useless since even if the enemy throws everything at you at once, most of it will still hit you and the nerfed cd doesn't help either...

I'm aware of the patch difference, but they didn't hit him hard enough to harm his kill potential.  His ult is still basically a guaranteed kill if coordinated.  He's still a relatively high banrate across all regions for this reason.

They touched his safety which means that, as a champ with no self-peel nor mobility, he's far more vulnerable, which in turn means that he can't go for his all-ins as much and he has to stay more passive so his kill potential, while not directly touched, has gone down.

They touched his safety because it was out of line.  His kill potential is still there, he just has to play it more intelligently instead of being able to flash in and mash keys.  The changes were justified, but he can still do the same amount of work with a competent jungler.

People just stopped being as aggressive on him because the nerf made them think they had to.  He can still block the first bit of CC and if they spam their spells together, they can still stack on the shield.  1/4 of a second of his passive is still good - it's hardly enough to say he's weaker.  People just play him differently because they think it's a bigger change than it was.  Kill totals are directly related to playstyles.  

Also, one thing you're overlooking is that his playrate went down in 6.15, yet his banrate doubled.  This will affect his total stats because he's played a lot less due to bans or people perceiving him as weaker and thus not playing him, even though his passive was the only thing touched.  And his kills and assists both went down by less than half a point in each column.  Basically, the only statistic that drastically changed from 6.14 to 6.15 was his banrate.  So he's played far less now, which will contribute to all of his numbers going down.  But none of them went down enough to think he's far worse off.

I did play a bit of malzahar both before and after the nerf and seriously, they could've made it 0.30 because, right now, it is a bit too short, especially with the nerf on its cd. 
I said he's weak, and he is right now, especially compared to pre-nef when he could face tank everything and still kill you. He's still viable if you are good with him (yeah, there are people who aren't that good with him, like me) and you can pretty much do the same you could do before.

> [{quoted}](name=Shlack123,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ANPju2bZ,comment-id=00080001,timestamp=2016-08-08T21:09:26.957+0000)
>
> Yeah, his near-100% pick/ban rate among the pros totally backs up your statement.  Kappa

I knew this would be brought up.

Here's the thing: Malzahar has always excelled at locking down a target for a guaranteed 2.5 seconds (sans anything that cancels/disrupts the effect) in team fights or when catching someone out, allowing his team to focus and kill the target. It can be game-winning in solo queue, which comes to no surprise that the pros have caught on to it. You may be wondering what took them so long to figure it out.

You see, before the rework, the problem was that outside of the ult, Malzahar offered virtually nothing but damage while having no innate safety, disengage or mobility. Doesn't seem like a big deal in solo queue, but that's **huge** in competitive play. The pros can _easily_ capitalize on those weaknesses, hence why Malzahar was never "pick or ban" or even at all popular. Why else do you think they almost always pick champions with mobility and/or disengage? 

Now that Malzahar has the pseudo-Banshee's shield, he can't be jumped on and killed so easily anymore, let alone not be completely vulnerable to ganks. That gave the pros the means to bring his targeted 2.5 second lock down into the spotlight. Even if Malzahar loses lane and gets behind, his ult still does work for his team.

Sounds just like {{champion:19}}, no?

Like Anidan said, the pros play a different LoL than we do. Often what's OP for them is UP for us, and vice versa.

> I knew this would be brought up

I only brought it up because you used the phrase
>Smart players know how to play around the passive and don't unload their full combos before it dissipates. Bronzies/stupid people who failed at this cried to Riot for nerfs.

The LCS isn't full of bronzies - they are all smart players.  So it's a very relevant counterpoint to your statement.

> [{quoted}](name=Shlack123,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ANPju2bZ,comment-id=0008000100010000,timestamp=2016-08-09T13:15:54.455+0000)
>
> I only brought it up because you used the phrase

>
> The LCS isn't full of bronzies - they are all smart players.  So it's a very relevant counterpoint to your statement.

Yes it is. However, as already mentioned by Anidan, they are playing a different League of Legends in the LCS than we are. You can't look at what they're doing and apply it to us. 
Besides, they are naturally far better with positioning and have full team coordination. It's why they can also get away with playing a mage like Viktor, who also lacks innate mobility until he get his augmented Q, and his W can easily be misplaced or not enough to stop many champions from getting to him.

I agree to a great extent.  I was just saying that because you made it seem like Malz wasn't deemed as OP if the players were smart - the pros prioritized him, so that nullified your statement.

I agree that the LCS and such are basically a different game, but the champions are still the same.  Hence my somewhat snarky response to your comment.

I use to main {{champion:90}} for middle lane before his rework and beyond till awhile ago; now I take my early sustain build for {{champion:31}} middle lane, since {{champion:90}} is super safe and all, but I find {{champion:31}}  does what he does with heavier crowd control and provides a tank to an otherwise squishy lane while {{champion:90}} has fallen more and more as the nerfs kept coming; super safe, but very immobile and I have trouble securing certain kills like from {{champion:7}} or {{champion:238}} while {{champion:31}} seems to have an easier time killing them or at least survivng their burst thanks to his innate tankiness and Feral Scream. This is just how I've expeirenced the changes, by no means did I think {{champion:31}} middle lane worked at first since I had some pretty tough games beforehand, but now I find him a better alternative to {{champion:90}} if I need to bring forth the wrath of the Void.

He needs like 2 to 3 items before he actually does damage now. His base damage values are a joke now and people have been running ghost on him to make more use of the suppression more than when getting a gank instead of the damage.
It's Malzahar. Riot does not really care if he succeeds or not.

I think he straight-up has fewer options than he did before. The only mechanic I like more now than before is that Q refreshes malefic visions, and  I like the quality of life changes to his q delay and aa animation. Other than that I feel constantly like I can't finish anything. And even if I do manage to play perfectly, I get KSed so fucking hard I fall off mid game and become nothing but a suppression bot for our now-fed ADC. I can't play him anymore because there's just no high moments with him at all. Every potential high moment is fucked by your kill-hungry teammates, or you get the 'satisfaction' of pushing the enemy out of lane with 10 HP because you don't... do... any... damage.

I remember the beauty of the Q-W-E-R Surprise! Fun Bush combos of old. :'( Rip pseudo-assassin Malzahar.
I mean, if your ADC is super fed, you're likely winning that game. I'd accept a Malz that got very few kills but helped his ADC get fed out the wazoo and subsequently win the match.

The thing about malz is that it's almost impossible to punish him unless he's playing hyper aggressively. Lowering the duration of his passive thing emphasized that to where the best strategy for him in high ranked games is just to farm indefinitely with no real risk.
It's already .25 seconds. How much lower do you scrubs need it to be?

Damage over time happens to be something that other players on the team abuse to take the kill from you.
It's not uncommon a Malzahar gets killstealed a lot.

That doesn't explain anything. Malzahar has had DoTs since he was released and never had this low of a number of kills.

I would argue it is his passive that encourages people to be passive and not interact with their opponent.

Before, once he got 6 he'd just flash ignite EWR and get an instant kill, now the enemy needs to be overextended or stupid af since most of Malzahar's kill pressure comes from triple E refresh and 3 voidlings bitting people for over 4 seconds.

Yeah, I guess that's true.

I expect the old passive promoted more agression, if you don't remember, every 4th spell spawning a Voidling.

I know, it was glorious. The original design for Malzahar was actually brilliant as it rewarded you for being engaging in lane and not being passive with a strong minion, which would normally be the reason to play passive.

Honestly, they should have never reworked Malzahar.

I disagree.  Old Malzahar was toxic to play against.  It would force AP mid laners to either take Cleanse or buy a QSS, both very suboptimal for champs who need to dish out a lot of damage.

Malzahar's rework didn't address his core problems and only exacerbated his issues for the player.  For his opponent, he's far more oppressive, however, because he gets more voidlings at once and his passive makes him able to absorb what would otherwise be preemptive counterplay to his all-in.

Malzahar's main weakness was that he need to push to take advantage of his passive, and when he didn't push and was sparing with his spells, his Voidlings would push for him. Malzahar was a jungler's dream target because he would very often overextend which leaves them open and their jungler less interested in ganking for him.

Basically the answer for Malz was either have a stun with travel time and stun Malz as he cast his ult, canceling it and putting it on full cooldown, or have your jungler gank often and make Malz's day hell. Malz was a great dueling/anti-solo champion, so you counter that by not playing his game on his terms.

I kind of feel as League's focus shifted from team play at all levels, tanks being more selfless, ADCs needs hardcore babysitters, to rewarding solo achievement, people try and beat a brick wall instead of ask their friend to bring the jackhammer.

Except isn't the second solution kind of true for almost every midlaner? I can't think of a midlane mage who could be ganked constantly and NOT suffer for it. Meanwhile, while your jungler is ganking Malz, they're not helping the other lanes or getting their own jungle CS.

About the counterplay of having hard cc with travel time, Riot ruined that with his new passive.  Sure they nerfed it, but it will still stop the first bit of hard cc you throw at him.  And a smart Malz isn't going to go all-in without his passive shield up, thus removing any hope for viable counterplay to his level 6 all-in.  And smart junglers will be looking to hit mid when Malz hits 6 because they know it's basically a free kill, barring any massive misplays or burned summs.  And no, hiding behind tower isn't viable counterplay, especially with Gragas being THE meta jungler today.  He can just ult you back into range for Malz to ult and you can do nothing but burn summs or die.

This is why Malz is pick/ban in all regions of professional play.
Doesn't that your mana costs and poor damage early on means trying to trade is actually a bad idea because you will go OOM really fast.

Early on you had to be smart with your spell casts, but if you pre-charged your Voidling on the fountain you could come to lane with an ace in your sleave (very useful against TF). This means you could wait for the right time to release it to make up for your poor early game costs and recover mana once you got Visions until your could get a Catalyst.
It's because Malz had more damage but less defenses before the rework. Now he has more defenses, less damage.
The old Malza was dealing really high damage, the rework is safer, but the damage is not very good...

I can almost guarantee it's because of his ult not having a base damage and only doing max% health. It's a bit harder to kill your opponent because they have to be lower in order for you ult to secure a kill. Even though it refreshes his visions, it's even more telegraphed now when malzahar wants to ult.

His deaths got lower?

https://s9.postimg.org/ensu100xb/Malzahar_6_14_Stats.png

https://s9.postimg.org/9zka3ajv3/Malzahar_6_15_Stats.png

I'm sorry what?

I never said anything about his deaths, it was his kills being abnormally low, which is odd for a damage centric champion. His deaths are slightly above average due to his passive encouraging an unhealthy passive play style. In my other thread about how Malz's gameplay fails to live up to its original concept, I argue that his passive should be changed back to his original Voidlings.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/jPsEmLsz-riotrepertoir-how-malzahars-voidlings-missed-malzahars-core-concept-in-the-rework

I think they overnerfed his passive. The cd nerfs were fine, but the 1 second -> 0.25 second? An assassin usually takes 1 second (or less depending on targets and users) to kill, and now they can start assassinating the champ meant to stop assassins incredibly easier. They gutted his damage for his passive to be that strong, so if his passive is gonna be in the weak-ass state it's in, I'd want some damage back somewhere.

His damage actually takes some finesse to keep-up. E, W (or WE)...wait...Q...if necessary, R for the potential kill and another refresh..Q a last time. For pretty low damage unless his voidlings are out. And without his core of Liandry, Rylai, Morello, VS (VS makes Liandry less garbage), he'd scratch tanks.

Malzahar's damage is fairly low early and mid game, not to mention it is DoT which gives him incredibly low kill potential as the enemy can just run away before too much damage has been done. The only instant damage he has is his Q which deals decent damage but its not super reliable.  

The dream was for him to build up Voidlings on minions with his E, then have the E bounce to his enemy. He then ults that person and wham bam thank ya mam they are dead. However this isn't very fun to fight against not to mention his Voidlings dished out a shit ton of damage to literally everything (see PBE and first week of release). So they lowered his damages, even so his Passive allowed him to play very aggressive which made up the difference in that he was impossible to punish. So they nerfed his Passive (and auto-attack range and his movement speed) and now here we are.  

Malzahar is no longer safe push with even though that is now his core design and he can't dish out as much damage as his opponents so he can't trade anymore. All you can do is sit back and farm until Late game when you point click melt anyone who steps too near to you. This is probably why he has such low kill rates, he can't even attempt to kill his enemies until he has 3-4 big items. By then the game is either won or lost, so you tend to have only a slight impact on the game kill-wise.  

Basically Riot set out to fix Old Malzahar's issues but instead created entirely new, perhaps even worse, issues while fixing none of the old issues. All they did was make my main less fun then before after making him too op so he was perma-banned...
Malz's biggest downfall is now he is much more of a sustained damage mage.  so he synergizes best with tanky teammates, the one thing that lower elo players hate playing as

malzahar doesn't deal to much damage

his skills make him scary for people to 1v1, and he's mostly a champion that pushes the lane

in other word _he can't straight out kill you_ unless you do something stupid ( for example I tried to fight one when he had 4 voidlings out.... got shredded at level 3 in less than 1 second.)    

h'es like viktor, except he has to use two spells instead of one.  If you have good AoE damage, you can just counter his pushes and stop him from shoving you under all game

think of it like a... temporary heimerdinger status.

when i play Malz my team will kill my viktom even if i have him ignited hit with E ult and all the voidlings and he was at 10 health to begin with
 i do with his ult had a base damage to stop that it doesnt have to be high like it was just 20hp at rank 3 just to stop the kill steal and let me enjoy my Overkill

His kill setup is very, very high.  So his actual damage has to be lower to compensate for the fact that at high levels of play, his ult is almost always a guaranteed kill or assist, and his voidlings provide nearly free objective takes due to the massive amount of dmg they tank.

Malz is nearly 100% pick/ban in competitive play.  His kill total does not reflect his true power.
